column4: description
column5: defeatedDescription

column4: There is madness in the eyes of the priest that stands before you, the madness of having seen more than any mortal should of the future.
column5: The priest looks almost relieved as he falls to the ground. "Thank you..." he whispers before passing.

column4: An armored champion stands before you, fanatical fervor burning in his eyes as he raises his sword to strike you down in the name of his god.
column5: You battle back against the righteous onslaught, finally defeating the armored warrior.

column4: The leather clad rogue before you gazes at you with what might be regret as he draws a wicked dagger. Apparently he cannot afford to allow any witnesses to his actions.
column5: Sensing defeat, the rogue hops away, disappearing into the darkness. You suspect you have now been added to a list you want no part of.

column4: One can never have too many knives.
column5: Looking at all of the blades stuck into the floor and walls, you can't help but wonder where they were all hidden...

column4: A numbing ice storm swirls around you while lightning strikes mere inches from where you stand. You’ve angered a spellstorm mage!
column5: The mage roars with elemental fury as you land a final, mortal blow.

column4: Did you stock up on potions of fire-resistance? You have little chance against a Master of Flame without some magical protection against fire.
column5: The defeated mage collapses to the ground, flames falling from his fingertips.

column4: This warrior's skill is as keen as his deadly blade.
column5: After a lengthy battle, the warrior holds his hand up as if to call things to a halt. He kneels at your superior skill, turns and walks away, his blade left at your feet.

column4: Heavy armor and strong defensive skills will make it hard to hurt this stalwart warrior.
column5: The battle rages for what seems to be an eternity, neither side able to budge the other. Finally, the warrior yields, granting you a well-earned victory.

column4: Going any further will be difficult with this indomitable guardian barring the way.
column5: The vanguard will not yield, despite your relentless attack. You do not wish to strike down such a valiant warrior, but it proves to be the only option.

column4: The warrior before you wields both sword and shield with a practiced ease that lets you know a true challenge lies ahead.
column5: Standing victorious over the defeated warrior, you pause to say a few quiet words. A challenger this skilled deserves to be remembered.

column4: The one-eyed giant swings his axe in a mighty downward stroke that would have split you in two if you had been a split-second slower in dodging aside.
column5: The cyclops falls, defeated. Once again you are forced to dodge a mighty, though unintentional, attack.

column4: Clouds gather around the cyclops as deafening claps of thunder drop you to your knees.
column5: Thunder and lightning crackle through the air as the mighty shaman is dropped to his knees. With one mighty strike, you separate his head from his body.

column4: The grotesque giant that bars your way seems to draw arcane power from the carved figures that surround you.
column5: Destroying the totems weakens the creature enough for you to get in a killing strike.

column4: The deformed monstrosity charging down upon you wields a sword the size of a young tree!
column5: The creature dead and the area demolished, you begin the long process of healing your many wounds.

column4: The beauty of the giantess before you is marred only by her oversized, hate-filled eye.
column5: Removing enchantment after enchantment, you finally break through to the witch herself, delivering a single, mighty stab through her one giant eye.

column4: You can clearly see the intelligence in this giant's single eye, but that doesn’t mean he won’t crush you like a bug.
column5: Much to your surprise, the cyclops would rather reason than fight. The two of you agree to let each other live in peace as you go your separate ways.

column4: This deformed monster gained his lofty position by crushing all who would dare oppose him - including you apparently.
column5: You topple the mighty giant, causing an instant power vacuum in the monster's military structure.

column4: Marching toward you in disciplined ranks is a squad of one-eyed giants.
column5: One by one, you separate the giants from their patrol. By only having to deal with a single monster at a time, you are able to defeat far more than one person should.

column4: The evil eye of a Fomorian Witch fixes upon you through the thick vapor rising from her cauldron. It's clear she wants to add you to the foul brew within.
column5: You tip the cauldron, sending the witch into a panic. While she's distracted, you seize the opportunity to put her down for good.

column4: What you thought was a row of colossal statues suddenly springs to life! You're caught in a Cyclops ambush!
column5: Thinking quickly you do the only logical thing: run away. The giants aren't able to track your tiny movements and eventually you are free from their pursuit.

column4: A nightmarish shape slips from the shadows, a face full of tentacles and a silvery blade flash before you!
column5: Turning away from the defeated nightmare, you do your best to wipe your mind of its horrible visage.

column4: The abomination before you lashes out with the power of its mind and suddenly all is madness. You struggle to make sense of the world before the mind flayer can feast upon your brain.
column5: Just as you think the creature is going to dominate you with its madness, you connect with a fatal strike that ends the creature's vicious attack.

column4: The mindflayer who stands before you sends wave after wave of mind controlled thralls against you. Can you defeat them all and still have strength enough to best their master?
column5: You topple thrall after thrall, finally reaching the mastermind. With one deft strike, you kill the mindflayer, freeing any remaining slaves.

column4: Rushing upon you is a gigantic creature so horrific and bizarre that you feel your grasp on sanity beginning to slip away.
column5: As soon as the monstrosity is defeated, you feel your sanity returning. It's a slow process, but eventually you should be back to normal.

column4: An army of mindless minions surges forward to attack. They know no fear and feel no pain. They are helplessly in the grip of their mindflayer masters.
column5: You put down the horde of thralls with relative ease. Now to find the abomination that made all this possible...

column4: Seeking ever to improve their species, the mindflayers perform experiments to create mutations like the twisted creature that shuffles toward you.
column5: You strike down the disfigured abomination, cursing whatever foul creature made this thing.

column4: A mass of disgusting larvae churn and wriggle through the slimy pool before you.
column5: Fire. You burn it all with fire.

column4: The gaunt creature turns its gaze upon you and you feel your every secret thought laid bare.
column5: "Get out of my head!" you scream before you black out. When you awake, the mindflayer is gone, along with your deepest secrets.

column4: Waves of mental energy radiate from the hideous walking brain that faces you.
column5: You wipe bits of brain from your armor, hoping to never see a creature like this again.

column4: Psychic blasts tear at your mind while savage claws tear at your body. You've fallen prey to an Intellect Devourer.
column5: Steeling your mind from the psychic attacks, you drive your weapon into the horrible creature, causing it to scream and run from the room.

column4: Arcane energy strikes you as you catch a glimpse of telltale scarlet robes. You face one of the red wizards of Thay!
column5: You pull bits of torn red cloth from your weapon and drop them on the corpse of your fallen enemy.

column4: "You fear death," says the warrior as he draws his blade, "but death makes a soldier of Thay more powerful."
column5: "Looks like today you will become even closer to death," you smile, as the dread wizard falls.

column4: Is it patriotism or charm spells that makes these Thayans such fanatical fighters? It matters little to you as you find yourself battling for your life.
column5: Unable to be saved by undying devotion alone, the fanatic falls to your superior might.

column4: "Since you have helped me accomplish my goal, our truce is now at an end!" snarls the red wizard. He raises a wand and points it directly at your heart.
column5: Acting quickly, you turn the wizard's wand back around, causing him to be the only victim of his betrayal.

column4: A half dozen laughing red wizards stand where there was only one a moment before. Five of them are illusions, but which?
column5: Nope. Nope. Nope. Success! You strike down your one true opponent and watch as the remaining illusions fade.

column4: The red-clad mage gestures wildly, speaking a few arcane syllables. Alternating blasts of fire and lightning explode around you!
column5: It's all you can do to avoid the elemental attacks and wait for the wizard to exhaust himself. When he finally does, he proves to be easy prey and you are rewarded for your patience.

column4: The stench of death wafts from the rotting red robes that hang from this wizard's skeletal arms. Undead himself, he commands a legion of the unliving.
column5: The necromancer falls, his legion of undead quickly following suit.

column4: A red-robed wizard stands confidently behind ranks of heavily armed soldiers. You'll have to cut your way through his guards before you can face this mage.
column5: The wizard watches on in horror as you dispatch guard after guard. "Wait! We can work something ou..." he sputters, unable to finish his sentence. 'Not today,' you think. 'Not today.'

column4: Arrogance and guile hang on this emissary like the fold of his ornate red robes. Clearly you'd be a fool to trust him.
column5: The ambassador snaps his fingers and you find yourself surrounded by guards. He offers to let you live in exchange for a favor to be named later. Seeing no other option, you begrudgingly agree.

column4: A mass of unliving iron and stone suddenly springs to life and reaches for you with powerful arms.
column5: The mass of metal and stone crashes to the ground as the enchantment leaves the golem.

column4: The pile of bones lying in the center of the room suddenly shudders, and then rises! A man-like form composed of the bones of many creatures begins to shamble toward you.
column5: You shatter bone after bone, eventually destroying the undead abomination.

column4: A tangible aura of evil surrounds this hateful creature. It will not rest until you have joined it in undeath.
column5: The wight defeated, you perform a purification ritual you hope will sanctify these grounds.

column4: A skeletal warrior, clad in the armor of old Neverwinter's elite guard, stands eternal vigil over this area. Regardless of your intentions, it will not let you pass.
column5: The warrior falls, enchantment ended. You collect a piece of the old armor, a relic worth keeping.

column4: Glowing with arcane energy, a fearsome bone golem stalks toward you, its powers augmented by necromantic magic.
column5: As you dispel the enchantments empowering the golem it collapses in a heap, turning the area into a charnel house.

column4: The skulls that make up much of this creature emit wailing cries of despair! Some foul curse has brought this golem to life.
column5: The curse is ended. Nothing remains of the golem but scattered fragments of bone that crunch beneath your feet as you pass.

column4: Composed of the skeletal remains of an entire company of slain soldiers, a massive bone golem towers above you.
column5: You leap clear of an avalanche of falling skulls and bones as your final attack disrupts the magic binding the massive golem together.

column4: The bones of creatures that have not walked the world in many thousands of years compose this mockery of life. Clearly this monstrosity was created in the long forgotten past.
column5: No doubt a sage would be interested in the ancient bones that made up the fallen golem. You're just happy it's no longer trying to kill you.

column4: Before you stands a leering champion of the undead, created in mockery of the noble paladin. May Kelemvor grant you the strength to overcome this abomination!
column5: Sword and shield falling from his faltering hands, the hero of evil topples to the ground. A true hero has triumphed!

column4: Once a mighty ruler buried in pomp and splendor, this ancient being now rules over a host of undead wights bound to his evil will.
column5: A tarnished crown rolls from his pallid head as the undead king falls, his reign of terror is at an end.

column4: Wearing the tattered garb of an empire long crumbled to dust, the wight that looms before you is as ancient as it is evil.
column5: The vanquished wight sighs as it crumbles to dust, its tortured spirit finally at rest.

column4: Expertly crafted and very well hidden, this tap has killed many adventurers.
column5: You disable a trap that would have surely killed you in your younger days.

column4: You know a masterwork spike trap is hidden here, but you aren't exactly sure where...
column5: Disabling this deadly spike trap is something very few people could even dream of.

column4: The pinnacle of craftsmanship, this arrow trap never misses.
column5: Like a ghost, you move past the trap completely undetected.

column4: One arrow from a trap of this quality is enough to kill most, a bank of arrows is enough to kill any.
column5: Using tricks developed over your long career, you disarm the deadly trap.

column4: A single dart fired with deadly precision may be the last thing you ever see.
column5: Faster than should be possible, you catch the dart before it can make contact.

column4: One wrong step and no one is walking away from this trap alive.
column5: Time seems to slow down as you dance perfectly around the deadly volley.

column4: Crafted from the finest adamantine, no one is meant to survive this trap.
column5: You catch a glimpse of the perfectly-integrated pressure plate, seconds before you trigger the deadly trap. That was too close...

column4: At least if you trigger this trap there won't be any lingering proof of your failure.
column5: You hear a click as the trap is triggered. Working quickly, you are able to disable the device seconds before acid fills the room.

column4: More than just weighty, these rocks have been carved and sharpened for maximum carnage.
column5: A tiny pebble falls from the ceiling, indicating the deadly rocks above. This tiny piece of luck saved your life.

column4: One misstep and the room will be brimming with deadly, otherworldly creatures.
column5: Finding the rune that would begin the summoning, you carefully rewrite it to destroy anything that might come through later.

column4: With a container this valuable, it's hard to imagine the riches contained within.
column5: A single tear runs down your cheek as you gaze within the golden chest.

column4: As though held by invisible strings, this radiant chest drifts back and forth across the room.
column5: Held up by your adventuring party, you manage to unlock the floating chest, gaining access to the riches within.

column4: The temptation to dive into the massive pile of gold is almost too great to resist.
column5: You fill your cart with every last coin, giddy over the new-found wealth.

column4: It will take several strong beasts-of-burden to drag this chest home.
column5: It takes the entire party to load the chest onto the wagon and even then you're not sure you'll be able to wheel it home.

column4: Larger than a typical grain sack, this gem purse is brimming with treasure.
column5: You sling the giant sack of gems over your shoulder, surprised by the weight.

column4: Leaning against a rock, you inadvertently trigger a secret door revealing an almost endless sea of riches.
column5: After gathering as much treasure as you can carry, you do your best to re-hide the door's trigger, hoping to improve on the original design.

column4: More a safe than a lockbox, the golden container has been imbued with explosive runes for anyone who shouldn't be opening it.
column5: You navigate the protective runes and open the golden lockbox, revealing the vast riches within.

column4: At first you think you've found an oddly-refracting pool, but on closer inspection you realize the entire floor holds perfectly-cut gems.
column5: You gather a handful of flawless cuts while the rest of your party loads the cart with the remaining gems.

column4: The most valuable scrolls imaginable would be kept in a container of this quality.
column5: You don't dare open the bag, for fear the air itself would destroy some of the relics contained within.

column4: There's an obvious indentation where a young dragon was once using this pile of treasure as a bed.
column5: Collecting all the riches you can possibly carry, you quickly leave the room before the dragon returns to find its bed disturbed.

column4: Within the empty blackness you catch a glimpse of a path to other worlds, other places.
column5: You follow the path to one of those other worlds, careful not to deviate even a single step.

column4: Dwarven runes line a series of superbly-crafted levers.
column5: Each rune tells a dwarven legend. By aligning the levers correctly and reading the legend aloud, you reveal a passage hidden in the floor.

column4: Dwarven runes surround a  simple-looking trap door. The ancient runes speak of impossible places that shouldn't exist.
column5: You lift the trap door and see a swirling mist. Steeling your nerves, you step into the unknown and find yourself transported to a previously-hidden location.

column4: You have only seconds to react before the portal vanishes!
column5: Diving headfirst into the portal, you stand in a brand new place, one you've never seen before.

column4: A single rune has been carved into each face of the puzzle box. If you can figure out what they mean, you might be able to activate them in the correct order...
column5: You take your time, being sure of your choices. Pressing the correct series of runes, the light around you fades, only to come back up once you've been moved to a strange new place.

column4: A locked, massive iron door blocks your path. Clearly crafted by dwarven master smiths, this will not be easy to open without the correct key.
column5: After defeating a nearby guard and taking his key to the door, you take a closer look at the mechanism. You are confident this door would never have opened without the key.

column4: For something so lacking in worldly-substance, you're surprised at the resistance you encounter.
column5: Speaking the correct magical phrase, the ethereal door changes color and allows you pass.

column4: A mixture of bodies, wood and iron, this barricade has been piled to the ceiling.
column5: There are no tricks to getting past this barricade. It just takes an extraordinary amount of time and effort.

column4: A small window slides open and a gruff voice says, "Sergeant Knox has a long mustache."
column5: "The blink dog is against the table." you reply. The window slides shut and the door swings open.

column4: A locked iron gate allows a glimpse beyond, but no passage without the proper key.
column5: You wait for a guard to come by to unlock the gate. As he does, you give him the choice: key or death. The guard chooses wisely...

column4: Amusing at first, each subsequent mirror shows a darker and darker reflection of the person looking into it.
column5: Unable to take any more, you leave the room, shaken and disoriented.

column4: Hellfire whips back and forth across the embers at the bottom of the massive pit. The heat is almost unbearable.
column5: Carefully, you manage to stay along the outside edge of the fire pit, barely able to withstand the extreme temperatures.

column4: You drop a large rock into the pit and wait for the sound of hitting bottom. You would wait for an eternity before hearing anything...
column5: Throwing other things into the pit, you decide it really doesn't matter if the pit is truly bottomless; anything falling in there will never see the light of day regardless.

column4: At first you see a single ghost moving through the darkness. Shortly after there's another and another. Most of them ignore you, but a few are beginning to look your way.
column5: Demanding you take part in the festivities, a few ghosts pick you up and carry you along for a ride. After a few hundred feet, the parade vanishes as mysteriously as it began.

column4: Looking into a pond, you see yourself but greatly disfigured and advanced in age. The visage speaks as it fades away, "Do not trust him. He will lead to ruin. Do not trust Sir R..."
column5: You splash at the pond and yell back at your reflection, but nothing happens. The water is still.

column4: "Please! If you help me I can promise you endless riches, fame, whatever you desire! Quickly! Before my captors return!"
column5: You untie the prince and help him up. "Thank you! Oh, thank you! When you return to town, be sure to find me! Your reward will be waiting!" It's not until he's long gone that you realize you never got his name...

column4: Exquisitely decorated, this golden idol is one of the most valuable single pieces you've ever seen. Surprising to find it unguarded...
column5: You clean the abomination's blood from your blade, it's corpse on the floor. Looks like the idol was guarded after all...

column4: "Let's play a game: See how many breaths you can take before I reach your throat. I'll bet it's fewer than you think..."
column5: "Sorry, I lost count," you say, stepping over the fallen assassin.

column4: A dying woman leans up and begs, "Please... it has to be you... last... rites..."
column5: You perform the last rites as her eyes close. A smile forms on her face as she is able to finally sleep in peace.

column4: Small water fairies float above a river. You think you can hear them giggle as they dance above the water.
column5: The sprites play and laugh with you for a while before vanishing back into the pond. A rare experience and one much enjoyed by the few allowed to partake.

column4: Atop a large, red velvet pillow sits a well-fed feline. You can hear it purr as it narrows its eyes and widens its grin.
column5: The cat purrs, allowing you to pet it. Without provocation, it attacks, sinking its claws into your hand. As it scampers away, you could swear you hear it say, "What do you expect? I am a cat, after all."

column4: Do you have what it takes to best the heartiest dwarf (still awake) in the championship round?
column5: You've done it! You are the new champion! Sadly, you're also the only one still conscious enough to celebrate...

column4: Angelic guards invite you to have a brief rest in their sanctuary.
column5: Nameless horrors try to visit while you rest, but the guards keep their promise and you stay safe within the sanctuary.

column4: "Aid me!" screams a wizard in blue. "No!" shouts a wizard in red from across the room, "Aid me! That one is a traitor and a liar! Unless you want to suffer betrayal, help me!"
column5: "Well chosen," gasps the victorious wizard. "I could not have done this without you."

column4: The mercenaries don't seem particularly interested in you. "We'll kill you if we have to, but we have no interest in that today."
column5: "We have enough enemies in this place," you say. The mercenaries nod and agree, leaving without incident.

column4: Is it a shrine made of gold or a shrine to the metal itself? Either way, it's definitely valuable.
column5: Upon closer inspection, you see an engraving warning against greed and desecration of the shrine. Unsure of what could be protecting it, you decide not to tempt fate.

column4: A skeleton struggles against blowing sand, forever trying to move forward, yet gaining no ground.
column5: Not wishing to share the poor creature's fate, you back away from the area with the hope that whatever curse was placed upon that room did not land on you as well.

column4: The beast has been dead far too long to reveal any indication as to how it died, but there might be a few scales left in the room...
column5: You collect the few dragon scales that still remain, some blue, some red. At least now you can guess that this creature died after a mighty battle with a long-lost foe.

column4: Young, handsome and completely depraved, the young master grins and readies a spell as his guards charge you.
column5: The guards fall easily, leaving their charge unprotected. "You will di..." screams the now-demonic master as you drive your weapon into his red flesh, causing him to explode in a burst of hellfire.

column4: Faces push from the stone walls, taking the forms of those you've lost. "You've forgotten us. You've forgotten..."
column5: You block out the voices, telling yourself that this is just a dream. Just a dream... Just a dream.

column4: You find a simple fountain intricately carved with symbols of love and hope. The water looks clear and crisp, exactly what you need right now.
column5: Angelic voices sing as you sip the refreshing water. You feel imbued with a holy spirit.

column4: The crowd has paid for blood. They don't care if it comes from you or someone else.
column5: The crowd screams your name and cheers your victory. You are the new champion of the cage!

column4: This chamber has sheltered many dark souls while they reflect upon the glories of chaos and evil.
column5: Burning down the walls and performing sanctification rituals hardly seems like enough, but it will have to do for now.

column4: You find a frail and severely beaten elf strung up on the rack. "Help me..." he mumbles, "before... it comes... back..."
column5: Turning around, you see an abomination drive a tentacle through the elf's skull, killing it. You get some level of vengeance when you defeat the alien horror, but you would have been happier if you could have saved the elf.

column4: Hanging from the ceiling are thousands of glass shards of varying shapes and sizes. Within each one a trapped soul suffers, waiting for rescue or release.
column5: With no way to reverse the spell, you shatter each piece of glass, freeing each soul that had been trapped within.

column4: A small child with yellow eyes holds a book of fairy tales. "Read me a story," she says, a demonic growl surrounding each word.
column5: "Mmm. Yes. That's my favorite story," sighs the demon child. "Time to sleep," she growls, eyes closing. She takes a deep breath, disappearing as she exhales a small puff of smoke.

column4: Eyes are painted on every surface, some human, some monstrous, and of all sizes and colors. Each one seems to follow your every movement.
column5: You've heard of places like this, a window to your world watched by monsters from other planes. You move through it quickly, doing your best not to look directly at any of the eyes.

column4: A slender man with a toothy grin hands you a heavy chain that runs through the wall. You feel it start to pull away as the floor opens up beneath you.
column5: Summoning all of your strength, you hold fast against the pulling chain, keeping the floor from swallowing the entire party. With a scream, you pull with all of your might, closing the trap. The strange man bows and disappears in a burst of violet fire.

column4: A slender man with a toothy grin sits at a table displaying a game board of some type. He motions for you to sit in the chair opposite him.
column5: The game goes on for hours, back and forth, each side having the upper hand at one time or another. In the end, you emerge victorious. The strange man smiles and disappears in a burst of violet fire.

column4: A slender man with a toothy grin hands you a book of spells before vanishing. You are suddenly surrounded by a magical field of violet fire closing in around you.
column5: As soon as you complete the final incantation, the violet fire vanishes. You are left alone in a quiet, empty room.

column4: It's hard to see much through the murk, but the melted walls tell you a black dragon is near.
column5: You stand victorious over the fallen black dragon. Now nothing can keep you from the dragon's hoard!

column4: Well-ordered magical decorations, sandy floor and light streaming in from above... a blue dragon lives here.
column5: A long and brutal battle, you ultimately stand triumphant over the blue dragon. The creature's hoard is all yours!

column4: The giant green dragon stands before you, flicking its long, slender forked tongue. "What will you offer in exchange for your life?" it asks with a smile.
column5: The green dragon puts up a terrible fight before falling to your final, desperate attack. "Didn't ... see ... that ... coming ..." it sputters before passing.

column4: The size of the beast almost distracts from the nearly overwhelming smell of smoke and sulfur.
column5: Nearly defeated, the beast lunges with a final attack. Luckily, you still have enough presence of mind to dodge and land a mortal wound on the massive creature.

column4: Once an evil blue dragon, this dracolich has only become more deadly, fearsome and cruel since its death.
column5: You wake up hours after the battle, unsure if you've crossed to the other side. On the far edge of the room, you see the impossible: the dracolich defeated.

column4: The drow priestess stands before you, surrounded by spiders and spiderlings. She almost seems to welcome you in as she looks at you with hungry eyes.
column5: Syndryth defeated, her followers aren't sure what to do now. They scurry away, lost and scared, finally knowing how they've made everyone else feel for years.

column4: An older warrior looks at you disapprovingly. "You should not have come," she growls as her body starts to shift and change.
column5: Marrowslake shifts back to human form. "Thank you," she says. "Thank you for ending this once and for all."

column4: The foul fomorian king stands before you, surrounded by a veritable army of grotesque followers. At least Fulminorax is nowhere to be seen...
column5: The other fomorians run away as soon as their king is dead. You consider going after them, but you find you barely have the strength to stand after that battle. They will have to be dealt with another day.

column4: Dark dreams fill your mind as disembodied voices speak to you, compel you, "Rest now. Your time is over. Rest..."
column5: The abomination writhes and flails before sinking into the murky depths below. No one else will have to endure its domination ever again.

column4: You can already feel dark madness spreading across your mind as the most powerful and feared of monsters floats over you.
column5: You slice a single stalk from the head of the fallen beholder. Without it, you doubt anyone would believe your tale of glory.

column4: Current champion of the arena, Molly has become a master rogue and a seemingly unbeatable competitor.
column5: Your victory over Molly earns you the arena's championship, along with the wealth and glory that comes with it.
column6: Defeat Molly Redstone and become the new champion!

column4: At the heart of the Giant Caverns sleeps Magra Curse-Eye. This is your chance to get the upper hand!
column5: Failing to sneak up on Magra, you are forced to do battle. It is a long and drawn-out fight, but in the end you stand victorious.

column4: A flesh-grafted abomination, Graft-Harrow is even more of a monster than it would be if it were pure mindflayer.
column5: The monstrosity defeated, you go about destroying the facilities that could create such a monster.

column4: Xivros sits behind a desk, hands clasped together. "Have a seat," he smiles.
column5: The master manipulator defeated, you do your best to discover what nefarious plans he had in the works.
column6: Stop the evil machinations of the calculating Xivros.

column4: A towering and terrifying construct, you're not sure if Shatterspine would be considered undead, abomination, or some combination therein.
column5: You strike a final, mortal blow, separating the construct's head from its body. It collapses to the ground, random bits flying in all directions.
column6: Find and defeat the construct known as Shatterspine.
